quiz.question: Dependency Injection
answer: technique where if an object requires a different object to function, supply it, rather than creating the instance within the object

quiz.question: Hash Collision
answer: occurs when a hash function returns the same bucket location for two different keys

quiz.question: Hash Function
answer: Deterministic, meaning given input will always generate the same hash function

quiz.question: 4 OOP principals
answer: Hide complexity while only showing relevant information

Complex data structure and you want to sort as effiently as possible, you create an algorithm for all different cases like if the data is in order, reverse order, skewed left, right, but in the end you just call .Sort()
Restricting access to some object's components (information hiding)
Keeping fields private but provide controlled access to them via public methods
Getter and setters, maybe you have an app that lets you see what your credit card balance is. You don't want that app to be able to set the balance to 0.
Create new child class while sharing functionality from its parent class
Prevents re-inventing the wheel (Don't Repeat Yourself - DRY)
Allows the ability to take on more than one form
method overloading - multiple methods with the same name, but different inputs
method overriding - change the functionality of method that was previously defined in a parent class

quiz.question: SOLID principles
answer: A class should only have a single responsibility
Software entities should be open for extension, but closed for modification
Objects in a program should be replaceable with instances of their subtypes without altering the correctness of that program. See also design by contract.
Many client-specific interfaces are better than one general-purpose interface.
One should depend upon abstractions, [not] concretions.

quiz.question: Design Patterns
answer: provide the capability to create objects based on a required criteria and in a controlled way
Ensure class has only one instance to be used across an entire system
organizing different classes and objects to form larger structures and provide new functionality
identifying common communication patterns between objects and realize these patterns

quiz.question: N-tier architecture
answer: Dividing application into multiple tiers, such as data tier, business tier, view tier

quiz.question: Service Oriented Architecture
answer: structuring your application into multiple services separating concerns while allowing them to communicate with one another

quiz.question: TCP vs UDP
answer: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is a connection-oriented protocol that computers use to communicate over the internet. It is one of the main protocols in TCP/IP networks. TCP provides error-checking and guarantees delivery of data and that packets will be delivered in the order they were sent.

User Datagram Protocol (UDP) is a connectionless protocol that works just like TCP but assumes that error-checking and recovery services are not required. Instead, UDP continuously sends datagrams to the recipient whether they receive them or not.

quiz.question: POCO
answer: a simple object that contains data
they don't care what/how they are being used

quiz.question: Java HashSet vs TreeSet
answer: TreeSet is stored in sorted, asc order.

quiz.question: Java hashCode()
answer: an integer value generated by a hashing algorithm

quiz.question: Java Garbage Collection
answer: automatic memory management, unused objected are deleted to free up memory

quiz.question: SQL Constraint
answer: enforce rules on the data columns
identify row/record in a given table, can be multiple columns

quiz.question: SQL Delete vs. Truncate
answer: Delete can be rolled back, does not reset identity, DML
Truncate can't be rolled back, resets identity, faster, recovers space, removes all records, DDL

quiz.question: SQL Identity
answer: type of column that generates a unique key value based on a given seed

quiz.question: SQL Alias
answer: temporary name assigned to table or column (AS keyword)

quiz.question: SQL Stored Procedures
answer: subroutine/function that you can save to be run with or without parameters

quiz.question: SQL Injection
answer: technique used to maliciously modify the data

quiz.question: SQL Trigger
answer: a stored procedure that runs on a given event

quiz.question: SQL Get Identity of Inserted Row
answer: @@Identity returns the last identity value in current session across all scopes
Scope_Identity() returns the last identity in current session in current scope (use this in most cases)

quiz.question: SQL Server vs. Oracle
answer: easier to work with, optimize better

quiz.question: SQL View vs Temp Table
answer: Basically a select statement shortcut (executes every time)

quiz.question: SQL CTE
answer: Common table expression allows definition of a temporary result set within the given scope

quiz.question: SQL Clustered vs. Non-Clustered Index
answer: Index that sorts datarows on one of their key values
allows for multiple indexes for a given column

quiz.question: SQL Cursor
answer: enables the processing of individual rows returned by a query

quiz.question: Database Normalization
answer: Design technique to reduce redunancy and dependacity of data, used to organize larger tables into smaller tables with linked relationships

quiz.question: How to store passwords in database
answer: Hash returns value that cannot be inverted
Salt is added to make the hash output unique

quiz.question: Rainbow table
answer: pre-computed lookup tables to crack password hashes

quiz.question: C# Object
answer: blueprint that specifies what that type can do

quiz.question: C# Accessor
answer: gets the value of a given private field
if defined, sets the value of a given private field

quiz.question: C# Access Modifiers
answer: can be accessed by any code within all assemblies
can only be accessed by code in the same class
can only be accessed by code in the same class or any dervied classes
can be accessed by any code within the same assembly, but not from another assembly

quiz.question: C# Struct vs Object
answer: Value type, can't be inherited or abstract or have default constructor
CONSIDER defining a struct instead of a class if instances of the type are small and commonly short-lived or are commonly embedded in other objects.

quiz.question: C# Generics
answer: Allows you to write a class or method that can work with any data type public class TestClass { }

quiz.question: C# Abstract vs. Interface
answer: Class can implement as many interfaces, but only one abstact class
abstract class can have non-abstract methods, where interface can only have abstract methods

quiz.question: C# using
answer: ensures that the given IDisposable object's Dispose method is called after execution, even if an exception is thrown

quiz.question: C# Garbage Collector
answer: non-determinalistic way that allows us to not have to manually free memory on the heap

quiz.question: C# delegate
answer: a type that specifies a method signature

quiz.question: C# lambda
answer: another way to define a delegate, syntatic sugar

quiz.question: C# volatile
answer: indicates field might be modified by multiple threads at the same time

quiz.question: C# virtual
answer: signals this method/property/indexer/event declaration can be overriden in its derived class

quiz.question: C# unsafe
answer: denotes unsafe context, which is required for any operation involving pointers

quiz.question: C# Static constructor
answer: Static constructor only executes once in the entire life cycle of the class

quiz.question: C# String vs. string vs. StringBuilder
answer: System.String is an alias for string

quiz.question: .NET CLR
answer: Common Language Runtime - runs managed code (written in .NET), unmanaged code is written outside of .NET

quiz.question: .NET routing
answer: routes urls of incoming requests and maps them to actions

quiz.question: Azure Artifacts
answer: create package feeds (like from NuGet) to organize/control packages

quiz.question: Web Server
answer: Software/Hardware needed to host a web application

quiz.question: Data Warehouse
answer: large store of data used for business analysis

quiz.question: Agile
answer: software-development methodology tool used to gather requirements before development and provides flexibility for any changes through a collaborative effort of cross-function teams and end users

quiz.question: Scrum
answer: defines roles, sets of processes (sprint planning, review, retro, etc) to provide transparency to the stakeholders while giving developers achievable goals within a short period of time (two weeks)

quiz.question: SDLC steps
answer: Plan -> Analyze -> Design -> Implement -> Test/Deploy -> Maintain

quiz.question: TLS
answer: protocall to secure communication between web server and browser

quiz.question: Tell me about yourself
answer: My name is Jonathan Budi. I'm a software engineer previously at J.D. Power where I was laid off because of a sale to private equity, a merger, and outsourcing. I majored in computer science at UCI, graduated in three years. I've been at J.D. Power for four years, we're a Microsoft shop, but still kinda old school. My role was kind of a jack of all trades, I worked on Ads, Automated QA, DevOps, Product Management, Design, to name a few. I do quantitative investing on the side, basically just some math and models to combine and play with the stock market. I also play a lot of basketball, trying to get back into shape. At the end of the day, I'm young and I'm gonna make mistakes, but I'm a quick learner and I'm ready to work.

quiz.question: Talk about a time when you had to work closely with someone whose personality was very different from yours.
answer: after building rapport, know the person tendancies
if the person is analytical, use that

quiz.question: Give me an example of a time you faced a conflict while working on a team. How did you handle that?
Talking Points
answer: Play to teammate's strength after building rapport
Handling things that are in our control when given a hard deadline (responsive redesign in order to sell company)
Ads Manager was a new project
Transitioning from SVN to Git, release management
Working with UX (Wai) to improve product

quiz.question: What was your role?
answer: Worked on consumer facing .NET web applications (jdpower.com and NADAguides.com)

quiz.question: React - why?
answer: Virtual DOM - faster than vanilla JavaScript
